thread.title: Tottenham 'set to finalise lucrative new kit deal with Nike for 2017/18 season'
thread.title_full: Tottenham 'set to finalise lucrative new kit deal with Nike for 2017/18 season'

author: Darren Wells
title: Tottenham 'set to finalise lucrative new kit deal with Nike for 2017/18 season'
text:
Sport Tottenham 'set to finalise lucrative new kit deal with Nike for 2017/18 season' The club have reportedly agreed a deal with the U.S sports brand to become their new kit supplier from the beginning of next season Share Harry Kane and Dele Alli showing off their celebratory handshake (Photo: Getty) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Nike are reportedly set to become the new kit supplier of Tottenham next season after the club finalised a deal with the sports brand. 
ESPN reports that the deal will begin at the end of this season as Tottenhams current five-year-deal with Under Armour comes to an end. 
The original contract with Under Armour brought the club £50 million total revenue, but the new deal with Nike is said to be worth roughly three times that figure. Tottenhams current deal with Under Armour will finish at the end of the season (Photo: REUTERS) Read More Dele Alli vs Eric Dier: A look at Tottenham's love-hate duo 
Spurs will not be the only Premier League team to sport a strip supplied by the sportswear giant, with Chelsea also set to be donning a Nike kit from the start of the 2017/18 season. 
Tottenham's agreement will pale in comparison to Chelsea's £60 million 15-year contract, but their own deal will be similar to rivals Arsenals £30 million a year deal with Puma. 
Manchester City are also sponsored by Nike, but their deal is only worth a reported £12 million a year up until 2019, whilst Manchester United lead the way with their £75 million per year contract with Adidas. Construction work on Tottenham's new stadium (Photo: REUTERS) 
News of the kit partnership suggests that Nike could well be involved in any deal for the naming rights of Tottenhams new stadium, due to open for the 2018/19 season. 
Spurs are due to move into their 61,000 seater, £400 million development for the start of the 2018/19 season. 
The stadium is under construction next to to their current White Hart Lane home, and the club released a detailed video of what it will look like . Like us on Facebook
